bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Domingo F. Ramos, February 26, 1945

div1.p: Hench, believing that Ramos sponsored his appointment to the Finlay Institute, thanks him for his support.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Domingo F. Ramos, February 26, 1945
div1.opener:
PSH/cb
26 February, 1945
Doctor Domingo Ramos
Director, Finlay Institute
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Ramos:
div1.p:
I greatly appreciate the honor recently transmitted to me by
Doctor Espinosa. I am quite certain that this honor came to me through
you and I wish to thank you very kindly for it. Although the appointment
is undoubtedly purely an honorary one, I am sincere when I ask if there
is anything particularly I can do to further the excellent relations
between the professions of our two countries.

Did you ever receive the numerous photographs which I sent you?
Not having heard from you, I assume that your plans were changed and that
you were not able to make the trip to give the lecture. If you are
through with the photographs, I would appreciate their return; however,
keep them as long as you wish. I also imagine that you have been unable
to arrange for the meeting which you mentioned in New York. In good
time doubtless these meetings will develop, and I shall be only too happy
to participate.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely yours, PHILIP S. HENCH, Lt. Col., M. C.
Chief of the Medical Service Enc. - copy of ltr to Dr. Espinosa
